vsim.linker

Class LinkedProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • vsim.linker.LinkedProgram

  • public final class LinkedProgram
extends java.lang.Object
    The LinkedProgram class is used to represent a RISC-V linked program.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LinkedProgram(java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Integer,Statement> program)
      Unique constructor that takes a history of statements.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getBreakpoints()
      This method returns an array of breakpoint addresses, i.g if a program contains ebreak statements these count as breakpoints.
      java.util.Collection<Statement> getStatements()
      This method returns all the available statements.
      Statement next()
      This method returns the next available statement.
      void reset()
      This method resets the program, localizes the global start address that is set in VSim settings and makes the program counter point to this address.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LinkedProgram

        public LinkedProgram(java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Integer,Statement> program)
        Unique constructor that takes a history of statements.
        Parameters:
        program - A history of statements
        See Also:
        Statement, Linker

    • Method Detail

      • next

        public Statement next()
        This method returns the next available statement.
        Returns:
        the next available statement or null if no more available
        See Also:
        Statement

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This method resets the program, localizes the global start address that is set in VSim settings and makes the program counter point to this address.

      • getStatements

        public java.util.Collection<Statement> getStatements()
        This method returns all the available statements.
        Returns:
        all the statements available statements
        See Also:
        Statement

      • getBreakpoints

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getBreakpoints()
        This method returns an array of breakpoint addresses, i.g if a program contains ebreak statements these count as breakpoints.
        Returns:
        an array of breakpoint addresses
